result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlando L Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

AS OF 6/14/2016: Credit for 360 days to be added
Concurrent with: 15CF923

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution to the City of Brookfield - paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

Defendant Orlando L Walker in court, in custody, with attorney Ann T. Bowe.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 2 and count 1 is dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:
 
IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT  
  -  1 1/2 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  1 1/2  YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION; SENTENCE TO RUN CONCURRENT

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
 
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Obtain his GED
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

RESTITUTION:  $1756.40 to City of Brookfield (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);
 
IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is  not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-14-2016 02:00 pm
Adjournment request filed by Attorney Bowe

Defendant Orlando L Walker not in court.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bowe did not appear. Court adjourns the matter for 30 days. Court will further order that the Order to Show Cause Matter will be heard at the next court date as to why attorney Bowe did not appear.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Orlando L Walker in court, in custody, with attorney Ann T. Bowe.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties are not ready to proceed to plea and sentencing. Court adjourns the matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Orlando L Walker in court, in custody, with attorney Ann T. Bowe.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Both parties are requesting adjournment. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-29-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Orlando L Walker in court, in custody, with attorney Ann T. Bowe.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bowe withdraws the speedy trial damand. Court grants the motion to joiner. Attorney Bowe is trying to resolve the matter and requests adjournment. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Motion for Joinder of Trial 15CF220 and 15CF923
Jury trial - 12 person on September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Orlando L Walker in court, in custody, with Attorney Peter M Wolff.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Wolff states that he will be getting additional information from the state and moves to withdraw motion.  Attorney Wolff  re-assets his motion for speedy trial, which would mean trial would need to be held by 8/6/15.  Court finds that there was not a full waiver of speedy trial on 6/25/15.  Court finds that in the interest of justice, it will grant a continuance of jury trial beyond the 90 days under 971.10(3).   Court sets jury status and jury trial date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on July 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Motion hearing on June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Orlando L Walker did not appear.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Wolff requests adjournment of trial. Attorney Wolff is waving defendant's appearance who is in custody, and presented statements to the court. 
Attorney Wolff withdraws and waives Speedy Trial Demand. 
State has no objection.
Court reschedules trial and notes that it will be within the Speedy Trial Demand deadline.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

to modify bail

Defendant Orlando L Walker in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for continued preliminary hearing.  City of Waukesha Detective Tyler Lusmann sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Szczupakiewicz.  Cross examination by Attorney Wolff.  State rests and moves for bind over.  Defense objects.  Closing statements.  Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Attorney Wolff to obtain a court date from Branch 1.
Preliminary hearing on May 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Orlando L Walker in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff and attorney Chelsea Williamson.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.  Attorney Szczupakiewicz is prepared to proceed, but would request an adjournment for additional witness to appear.  Attorney Wolff objects.  Court proceeds today and will allow an adjournment for the additional witness to appear.  City of Brookfield Sergeant Bryan Franckowiak sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Szczupakiewicz.  Cross examination by Attorney Williamson.  Redirect by Attorney Szczupakiewicz.  State intends to call an additional witness.  Court continues the preliminary hearing.  Attorney Williamson requests a bail modification.  State objects to a bail modification.    The Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Demand for Jury attached. Filed by Atty Wolff.
Preliminary hearing on May 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
